engines: 1.3L Turbo I4 plug-in hybrid (288 hp combined)
notes: Compact crossover based on Alfa Romeo Tonale platform (STLA Medium). Available as plug-in hybrid R/T model with 288 hp combined output. Turbo I4 gasoline or PHEV powertrain. Hybrid systems require PHEV-trained technicians. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Hornet article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 3.0L Hurricane twin-turbo I6 (420 hp Standard Output)
3.0L Hurricane twin-turbo I6 (550 hp High Output)
notes: All-new seventh-generation Charger on STLA Large platform. Twin-turbo Hurricane I6 replaces Hemi V8. Sixpack name honors historic performance. Standard Output (420 hp) or High Output (550 hp) twin-turbo configurations. Modern turbocharged complexity. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Charger article, January 2025 revision.

All-electric Charger variant on STLA Large platform. 400V or 800V battery architecture. Scat Pack model produces 670 hp. Simulated exhaust sound (Fratzonic Chambered Exhaust). High-voltage EV system requires EV-certified technicians. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Charger article, January 2025 revision.

Final years of third-generation Durango. Based on Mercedes ML platform. SRT 392 and Hellcat high-performance variants with 6.4L Hemi (475-710 hp). Last Hellcat Durango produced 2023. Three-row SUV capability. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Durango article, January 2025 revision.
